Job Title: Millwright - 1936392

Location: Piedmont, SC

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Management, Manufacturing

Description:
Group Overview:

Our client is a leading global Tier 1 automotive supplier, offering a comprehensive range of body, chassis, and engineering solutions. They are dedicated to delivering lightweight and innovative products to the market through robust product engineering, exceptional tooling capabilities, and diverse process expertise.

This is an outstanding direct-hire opportunity with a top-tier automotive supplier on a global scale.

Role Summary: Millwright

As a Press Maintenance Millwright, you will be responsible for maintaining and repairing production and non-production equipment in the press shop. This includes presses, transfers, automation, destackers, blanking lines, cranes, scrap conveyors, and tool room equipment.

Responsibilities: Millwright

 Maintain production and non-production equipment in the press shop Troubleshoot mechanical, hydraulic, and pneumatic systems Perform daily routine and scheduled PM checks on assigned equipment Ensure assigned equipment is clean, safe, and in good working condition Perform major repairs and overhauls on equipment as needed, including overtime, long hours, and weekend/holiday work Respond to production calls to repair issues causing downtime or quality concerns


Qualifications: Millwright

 Associate’s degree or equivalent from a two-year college or technical school; or five years of experience and/or training; or equivalent combination of education and experience Ability to read and understand blueprints and use the metric system Strong fabrication, machining, or mechanical skills Welding and cutting torch skills Ability to work with minimum or no supervision


Preferred Qualifications:

 Knowledge of hydraulic and/or pneumatic systems Basic computer skills


Benefits:

You can expect an engaging and dynamic work environment where you can contribute to the development of industry-leading automotive technologies. We invest in our employees, providing them with the support and resources they need to succeed. As a member of our global team, you can expect exciting, varied responsibilities as well as a wide range of development prospects because we believe that your career path should be as unique as you are.

Site Benefits:

 Referral Program - Up to $1,000 per hired referral Onsite cafeteria with multiple fresh-cooked options and salad bar, and fully stocked breakrooms throughout the plant Annual events (Summer cookout, Christmas party, etc.) Onsite Nurses' office Onsite Mother's room


#onsite

Experience Level (if available): Associate
